meanings.definition: The quality of being able to express oneself clearly and effectively in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her articulateness in the presentation impressed the audience.
meanings.sent2: His articulateness in explaining complex ideas made the topic easier to understand.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's articulateness in mimicking human speech always amused the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The articulateness of the river flowing through the valley painted a vivid picture of tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's articulateness in storytelling captivated the students' attention.

meanings.definition: The quality of being well-spoken or fluent in communication.
meanings.sent1: The politician's articulateness in debates won over many voters.
meanings.sent2: Her articulateness in public speaking made her a sought-after presenter.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's articulateness in delivering jokes always brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The articulateness of the violinist's performance touched the hearts of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: His articulateness in negotiations helped him secure a favorable deal.
